thread.title: Mass shootings in Oregon: a list
thread.title_full: Mass shootings in Oregon: a list

author: Michelle Brence | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Mass shootings in Oregon: a list
text:
Oregon mass shootings 
Oregon shootings in which a gunman opened random fire in a public place (excluding gang-related shootings). 
Nov. 12, 1984, Eugene: University of Oregon student Michael Feher, 19, roamed Autzen Stadium dressed in combat gear and armed with a high-powered rifle and a shotgun. He fired at random, killing former Olympic sprinter Christopher Brathwaite and injuring a UO wrestler before killing himself. 
May 20-21, 1998, Springfield: Kip Kinkel, 15, shot and killed his parents, Bill and Faith Kinkel, at home on May 20, 1998. The next morning, he opened fire at Thurston High School , killing classmates Mikael Nickolauson and Ben Walker, and wounding 25 others. Kinkel is serving a 111-year sentence at a Salem prison. 
April 10, 2007, Gresham: Springwater Trail High School student Chad Escobedo, 15, fired a rifle into two classrooms at the school. Ten students were injured by flying glass. He pleaded guilty to assault with a firearm and unlawful use of a weapon, and was sentenced to nearly six years in Oregon Youth Authority custody. 
Jan. 24, 2009, Portland: Erik Ayala, 24, shot eight teens and an adult outside a downtown underage club called The Zone. Two died: 17-year-old Martha Paz De Noboa, an exchange student from Peru, and 16-year-old Ashley Wilkes of Happy Valley. Ayala fatally shot himself outside the club. 
Dec. 11, 2012, Clackamas: Jacob Roberts, 22, opened fire at Clackamas Town Center on the afternoon of Dec. 11, 2012. He killed Steven Forsyth and Cindy Yuille, and seriously injured a 15-year-old girl before shooting and killing himself. 
June 10, 2014, Troutdale: Jared Padgett, 15, took a rifle to Reynolds High School with a plan to kill classmates. He shot and killed Emilio Hoffman, 14, in a locker room and grazed a teacher. After police confronted him, he shot himself in the head and died. 
Oct. 1, 2015, Roseburg: Chris Harper-Mercer, 26, opened fire in his writing class at Umpqua Community College, killing eight classmates and his professor, and wounding nine others. He shot and killed himself after he was shot and wounded by police. Those who lost their lives were: Lucero Alcaraz, 19; Quinn Glen Cooper, 18; Lucas Eibel, 18; Jason Johnson, 33; Lawrence Levine, 67; Sarena Dawn Moore, 44; Treven Aspach, 20; Rebecka Carnes, 18; and Kim Saltmarsh Dietz, 59. 
-- Michelle Brence
